title: section 2 (1) of the Ministers and Secretaries (Amendment) (No. 2) Act 1977
heading: 1. This Order may be cited as the Housing, Local Government and
text_raw:
1. This Order may be cited as the Housing, Local Government and 

Heritage (Delegation of Ministerial Functions) Order 2023.
text_norm: 1 order may cited housing local government heritage (delegation ministerial functions) order 2023

title: section 2 (1) of the Ministers and Secretaries (Amendment) (No. 2) Act 1977
heading: 2. The powers (other than the power to prosecute an offence) and duties of
text_raw:
2. The powers (other than the power to prosecute an offence) and duties of 

the Minister for Housing, Local Government and Heritage conferred on him - 

(i) 

by or under the provisions of the enactments specified in 
Part 1 of the Schedule, 

(ii) by or under the enactments specified in Part 2 of the 

Schedule, and 

(iii) under the instruments specified in Part 3 of the Schedule, 
are delegated to Kieran O’Donnell, Minister of State at the 
Department of Housing, Local Government and Heritage. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 10th March, 2023. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [116] 3
text_norm: 2 power (other power prosecute offence) duty minister housing local government heritage conferred - (i) provision enactment specified part 1 schedule (ii) enactment specified part 2 schedule (iii) instrument specified part 3 schedule delegated kieran donnell minister state department housing local government heritage notice making statutory instrument published iris oifigiuil 10th march 2023 116 3

title: section 2 (1) of the Ministers and Secretaries (Amendment) (No. 2) Act 1977
heading: Section 71 of the Local Government (Dublin) Act 1930 (No. 27 of 1930)
text_raw:
SCHEDULE 

PART 1 

Section 71 of the Local Government (Dublin) Act 1930 (No. 27 of 1930) 

Section 20(4) of the Cork City Management (Amendment) Act 1941 (No. 5 of 
1941) 

Section 5 of the Local Government (Rates) Act 1970 (No. 2 of 1970) 

Section 10 of the Local Government (Financial Provisions) Act 1978 (No. 35 
of 1978) 

Sections 5 and 6 of the Housing (Miscellaneous Provisions) Act 1979 (No. 27 
of 1979) 

Sections 28 to 34 of the Local Government Act 1991 (No. 11 of 1991) 

Section 6 of the Local Government Act 1998 (No. 16 of 1998) 

Section 56 of the Valuation Act 2001 (No. 13 of 2001) 

The following sections of the Local Government Act 2001 (No. 37 of 2001): 

22A, 23, 44, 48, 51, 52, 54, 68, 75, 87, 96, 102, 103, 103A, 104, 106, 107, 108, 
111, 115 to 118, 120 to 123, 125, 126, 126C, 126D, 126K, 128, 129C, 129G, 
131, 131A, 133, 134, 134A, 136, 142 to 148, 151, 156, 158, 160, 161, 162, 
167, 169, 171, 174 to 176, 183, 189, 190, 192, 199 to 201, in so far as the 
references to appropriate Minister in those sections relate to the Minister for 
Housing, Local Government and Heritage, 206, 210, 221 to 223, 225, 231, 233, 
and 237A 

Sections 29(8) and 31 of the Local Government Reform Act 2014 (No. 1 of 
2014) 

Sections 8 and 28(1) of the Harbours Act 2015 (No. 61 of 2015) 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [116] 

Section 23 of the Local Government Rates and other Matters Act 2019 (No. 24 
of 2019) 

Sections 60 and 61 of the Electoral Reform Act 2022 (No. 30 of 2022) 

PART 2 

Foreshore Acts 1933 to 2022 

Building Control Acts 1990 to 2020 

Derelict Sites Act 1990 

Urban Renewal Act 1998 (No. 27 of 1998), other than Part III 

Housing (Traveller Accommodation) Act 1998 (No. 33 of 1998) 

Planning and Development Acts 2000 to 2022 (No. 30 of 2000), other than 
Chapter 1 of Part VI 

Licensing of Indoor Events Act 2003 (No. 15 of 2003) 

Pyrite Resolution Act 2013 (No. 51 of 2013), other than sections 10 and 11 

Local Government Act 2019 (No. 1 of 2019) 

PART 3 

European Communities (Environmental Assessment of Certain Plans and 
Programmes) Regulations 2004 to 2011 

European Union (Marine Strategy Framework) Regulations 2011 (S.I. No. 249 
of 2011) 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [116] 5 

GIVEN under the Official Seal of the Government, 

7 March, 2023. 

LEO VARADKAR, 

Taoiseach. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 6 [116] 

BAILE ÁTHA CLIATH 
ARNA FHOILSIÚ AG OIFIG AN tSOLÁTHAIR 
Le ceannach díreach ó 
FOILSEACHÁIN RIALTAIS, 
BÓTHAR BHAILE UÍ BHEOLÁIN, 
CILL MHAIGHNEANN, 
BAILE ÁTHA CLIATH 8, 
D08 XAO6 

Teil: 046 942 3100
